availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Emanuel Bamberger (Louisville, Kentucky, dry goods merchant)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, merchant. Native of Germany. Married to Clara Kling Bamberger. Father of Jacob Bamberger, Francis Bamberger, Levi Bamberger, Sophia Bamberger, Julius Bamberger, Isaac Bamberger, Simon Bamberger, Socrata Bamberger, and Abraham Bamberger. Merchant in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Dry goods wholesale merchant in E. Bamberger & Company in Louisville in 1858. Dry goods wholesale merchant in partnership with William H. Moore and Nathan Bloom in E. Bamberger & Company in Louisville in 1861 to 1862. Wholesale dry goods merchant in partnership with Nathan Bloom in E. Bamberger & Company in Louisville from 1862 to 1865. Resident of New York City, New York, in 1863. Dry goods wholesale merchant in partnership with Levi Bamberger and Nathan Bloom in Bamberger, Bloom, & Company in Louisville in 1865.
